channel.title: torbrowser script bug Not working
channel.description:
Hello, this is my first time using whonix, i installed it on virtualbox 6.1.12 and my computer OS is windows 10. Before launching the browser on workstation, the only thing i did was to make the suggested updates.
"... Please update Whonix-Gateway and Whonix-Workstation: (Open a terminal, Start Menu -> System -> Terminal.) sudo apt-get-update-plus dist-upgrade"
after that i tried to launch the browser from the workstation but i got the "/usr/bin/torbrowser script bug." error
I tried to launch it through the terminal, but got the same error
" cp: failed to access '/home/user/.tb/tor-browser': Permission denied [ERROR] [torbrowser] /usr/bin/torbrowser script bug.
No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition has been hit. Try again later. If this is a transient issue, it can be safely ignored.
There is likely a solution for this problem.
* Please see the Whonix News. ## * Whonix User Help Forum. ## * And Whonix Documentation. ##
It may or may not be possible to fix but further information may be required.
* Try start from command line. ## * Try start from command line with debugging enabled. ## * If you don't mind to repair that Tor Browser install, reinstall of Tor Browser would also likely solve this. ##
Debugging information:
BASH_COMMAND: cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber "/var/cache/tb-binary/$tb_install_folder_dot/$tb_browser_name" "$tb_browser_folder" exit_code: 1
tb_browser_folder: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser
tb_user_js_target_file: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default/user.js
output: /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector output_opts: --icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico --parentpid 9745 --identifier torbrowser --parenttty /dev/pts/1 --whoami user progressbaridx:
Experts only: bash -x torbrowser "
launching it in debug mode i get this message
"bash: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser: Permission denied"
I checked the directory from the file manger, but the ".tb" directory on "/home/user/" is empty i don't know if this means anything...
This is what i get from whonixcheck
" [INFO] [whonixcheck] Connected to Tor. [INFO] [whonixcheck] Whonix is produced independently of, with no guarantee from, The Tor Project. Whonix is a research project. ## [INFO] [whonixcheck] Whonix APT Repository: Enabled. When the Whonix team releases BUSTER updates, they will be AUTOMATICALLY installed (when you run apt-get dist-upgrade) along with updated packages from the Debian team. Please read ## to understand the risk. If you want to change this, use: sudo whonix_repository [INFO] [whonixcheck] Debian Package Update Check: Checking for software updates via apt-get... ( Documentation: ## ) [INFO] [whonixcheck] Debian Package Update Check Result: No updates found via apt-get. [INFO] [whonixcheck] Please donate! See: ## "
Hope you can help me. Thank you

item.title: torbrowser script bug Not working
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
A post was split to a new topic: tb-updater - GPG download signature could NOT be verified. - This key expired.

Read full topic

item.title: torbrowser script bug Not working
item.dc:creator: riccardo315
item.description:
Patrick:

sudo chmod --recursive

the rm command was successful, but the chmod gives me an error

chmod: invalid mode: ‘user:user’
Try ‘chmod --help’ for more information.

Read full topic

item.title: torbrowser script bug Not working
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
If there is no user data in Tor Browser that matters… Delete the folder and fix access rights.

sudo rm -r /home/user/.tb
sudo chown --recursive user:user /home/user

Don’t run GUI applications as root as per
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Root#Graphical_Applications_with_Root_Rights

And “doesn’t work -> try sudo” -> don’t do that. sudo / root is only to be used if that is the sensible thing to do. Otherwise home folder permissions might get broken.

Read full topic

item.title: torbrowser script bug Not working
item.dc:creator: riccardo315
item.description:
Hello, this is my first time using whonix, i installed it on virtualbox 6.1.12 and my computer OS is windows 10.
Before launching the browser on workstation, the only thing i did was to make the suggested updates.

“… Please update Whonix-Gateway and Whonix-Workstation: (Open a terminal, Start Menu -> System -> Terminal.) sudo apt-get-update-plus dist-upgrade”

after that i tried to launch the browser from the workstation but i got the “/usr/bin/torbrowser script bug.” error

I tried to launch it through the terminal, but got the same error

"
cp: failed to access ‘/home/user/.tb/tor-browser’: Permission denied
[ERROR] [torbrowser] /usr/bin/torbrowser script bug.

No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition has been hit.
Try again later. If this is a transient issue, it can be safely ignored.

There is likely a solution for this problem.

  • Please see the Whonix News. ##
  • Whonix User Help Forum. ##
  • And Whonix Documentation. ##

It may or may not be possible to fix but further information may be required.

  • Try start from command line. ##
  • Try start from command line with debugging enabled. ##
  • If you don’t mind to repair that Tor Browser install, reinstall of Tor Browser would also likely solve this. ##

Debugging information:

BASH_COMMAND: cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber “/var/cache/tb-binary/$tb_install_folder_dot/$tb_browser_name” “$tb_browser_folder”
exit_code: 1

tb_browser_folder: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser

tb_user_js_target_file: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default/user.js

output: /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector
output_opts: --icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico --parentpid 9745 --identifier torbrowser --parenttty /dev/pts/1 --whoami user
progressbaridx:

Experts only:
bash -x torbrowser
"

launching it in debug mode i get this message

“bash: /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser: Permission denied”

I checked the directory from the file manger, but the “.tb” directory on “/home/user/” is empty i don’t know if this means anything…

This is what i get from whonixcheck

"
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Connected to Tor.
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Whonix is produced independently of, with no guarantee from, The Tor Project. Whonix is a research project. ##
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Whonix APT Repository: Enabled.
When the Whonix team releases BUSTER updates,
they will be AUTOMATICALLY installed (when you run apt-get dist-upgrade)
along with updated packages from the Debian team. Please
read ## to understand the risk.
If you want to change this, use:
sudo whonix_repository
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Debian Package Update Check: Checking for software updates via apt-get… ( Documentation: ## )
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Debian Package Update Check Result: No updates found via apt-get.
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Please donate!
See: ##
"

Hope you can help me. Thank you

Read full topic
